==Events==
* [[138]] &ndash; The [[Roman emperor]] [[Hadrian]] adopts [[Antoninus Pius]], effectively making him his successor.
* [[493]] &ndash; [[Odoacer]] surrenders [[Ravenna]] after a 3-year [[siege]] and agrees to a mediated peace with [[Theodoric the Great]].
* [[628]] &ndash; [[Khosrau II]] is overthrown by his son [[Kavadh II]].
*[[1336]] &ndash; 4,000 defenders of [[Pilėnai]] commit mass suicide rather than be taken captive by the [[Teutonic Knights]].
*[[1570]] &ndash; [[Pope Pius V]] [[Excommunication|excommunicates]] Queen [[Elizabeth I of England]].
*[[1631]] &ndash; [[François de Bassompierre]], a French courtier, is arrested on [[Cardinal Richelieu|Richelieu]]'s orders.
*[[1797]] &ndash; [[Colonel William Tate]] and his force of 1000-1500 soldiers surrender after the [[Battle of Fishguard|Last invasion of Britain]].
*[[1821]] &ndash; [[Greek War of Independence]]: [[Alexander Ypsilantis]] issues a proclamation at [[Iași]], announcing that he had "the support of a great power" (i.e. Russia).
*[[1831]] &ndash; [[Battle of Olszynka Grochowska]], part of Polish [[November Uprising]] against Russian Empire.
*[[1836]] &ndash; [[Samuel Colt]] is granted a United States [[patent]] for the [[Colt Firearms|Colt]] [[revolver]].
*[[1843]] &ndash; [[Provisional Cession of the Hawaiian or Sandwich Islands]] established by [[Lord George Paulet]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; Provisional government in [[French Revolution of 1848|revolutionary]] France, by [[Louis Blanc]]'s motion, guarantees workers' rights.
*[[1856]] &ndash; A [[Congress of Paris (1856)|Peace conference]] opens in Paris after the [[Crimean War]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; Miners in [[Calaveras County, California]], discover what is now called the [[Calaveras Skull]] -  human remains that supposedly indicated that man, [[mastodon]]s, and [[elephant]]s had co-existed.
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Hiram Rhodes Revels]], a [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] from [[Mississippi]], is sworn into the [[United States Senate]], becoming the first [[African American]] ever to sit in the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]].
*[[1875]] &ndash; [[Guangxu Emperor]] of [[Qing Dynasty|China]] begins his reign, under [[Empress Dowager Cixi]]'s regency.
*[[1901]] &ndash; [[J. P. Morgan]] incorporates the [[U.S. Steel|United States Steel Corporation]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Marie-Adélaïde, Grand Duchess of Luxembourg|Marie-Adélaïde]], the eldest of six daughters of [[Guillaume IV, Grand Duke of Luxembourg|Guillaume IV]], becomes the first reigning [[Grand Duke of Luxembourg|Grand Duchess]] of [[Luxembourg]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: the Germans capture [[Fort Douaumont]] during the [[Battle of Verdun]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Oregon]] places a one cent per U.S. [[gallon]] [[gasoline tax|tax on gasoline]], becoming the first [[U.S. state]] to levy a gasoline tax.
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[Tbilisi]], capital of the [[Democratic Republic of Georgia]], is [[Soviet invasion of Georgia|occupied]] by [[Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic|Bolshevist Russia]].
*[[1928]] &ndash; [[Charles Jenkins Laboratories]] of [[Washington, D.C.]] becomes the first holder of a [[television]] license from the [[Federal Radio Commission]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[Adolf Hitler]] obtains German citizenship by [[naturalization]], which allows him to run in the 1932 election for [[Reichspräsident]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; The {{USS|Ranger|CV-4|6}} is launched. It is the first US Navy ship to be built solely as an [[aircraft carrier]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[February Strike]]: In [[History of the Netherlands (1939-1945)#German occupation|occupied Amsterdam]], a [[general strike]] is declared in response to increasing anti-Jewish measures instituted by the [[Nazi]]s.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Turkey]] declares war on Germany.
*[[1947]] &ndash; The State of [[Prussia]] ceases to exist.
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[Communist Party of Czechoslovakia|Communist Party]] [[Czechoslovak coup d'état of 1948|takes control]] of government in [[Czechoslovakia]] and the period of the [[History of Czechoslovakia (1945&ndash;1948)|Third Republic]] ends.
*[[1951]] &ndash; The first [[Pan American Games]] are held in [[Buenos Aires]], Argentina.
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]] is made premier of [[Egypt]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; In his speech ''[[On the Personality Cult and its Consequences]]'', [[Nikita Khrushchev]], leader of the [[Soviet Union]] denounces the [[cult of personality]] of [[Joseph Stalin]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[North Korea]]n Prime Minister [[Kim Il-sung]] calls for the removal of [[Feudalism|feudalistic]] land ownership aimed at turning all [[cooperative]] farms into state-run ones.
*  1964   &ndash; U.S. Air Force launches a satellite employing a US Air Force Atlas/Agena combination from [[Vandenberg AFB Space Launch Complex 4|Point Arguello]] (LC-2-3) in California and from [[Cape Kennedy]] in Florida.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: 135 unarmed citizens of Hà My village in [[South Vietnam]]'s [[Quảng Nam Province]] are killed and buried ''en masse'' by [[Republic of Korea Marine Corps|South Korean troops]] in what would come to be known as the [[Hà My massacre]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; The first unit of the [[Pickering Nuclear Generating Station]], the first commercial [[nuclear power]] station in Canada, goes online.
*[[1980]] &ndash; The government of [[Suriname]] is [[1980 Surinamese coup d'état|overthrown by a military coup]] which is initiated by the bombing of the police station from an army ship off the coast of the nation's capital, [[Paramaribo]]
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[People Power Revolution]]: President of the Philippines [[Ferdinand Marcos]] flees the nation after 20 years of rule; [[Corazon Aquino]] becomes the [[Philippines]]' first woman president.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Southern Methodist University]]'s football program is the first college football program to receive the [[Death Penalty (NCAA)|Death Penalty]] by the NCAA's Committee on Infractions.  It was revealed that athletic officials and school administrators had knowledge of a "[[slush fund]]" used to make illegal payments to the school's football players as far back as 1981.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Gulf War]]: An [[Iraq]]i [[scud missile]] hits an American military barracks in [[Dhahran]], [[Saudi Arabia]] killing 28 [[United States Army Reserve|U.S. Army Reservists]] from [[Pennsylvania]].
*  1991   &ndash; The [[Warsaw Pact]] is declared disbanded.
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[Khojaly massacre]]: about 613 civilians are killed by [[Armenia]]n armed forces during the conflict in the [[Nagorno-Karabakh]] region of [[Azerbaijan]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Mosque of Abraham massacre]]: In the [[Cave of the Patriarchs]] in the [[West Bank]] city of [[Hebron]], [[Baruch Goldstein]] opens fire with an automatic rifle, killing 29 [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]] worshippers and injuring 125 more before being subdued and beaten to death by survivors.
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Yi Han-yong]], North Korean defector was murdered by unidentified assailants in [[Bundang]], [[South Korea]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; Members of the [[Border Guards Bangladesh|Bangladesh Rifles]] [[2009 Bangladesh Rifles revolt|mutiny]] at their headquarters in Pilkhana, [[Dhaka]], Bangladesh, resulting in 74 deaths, including more than 50 army officials.
